Question: Which of the following drains directly into inferior vena cava?
Choices:
  A: Superior mesenteric vein
  B: Inferior mesenteric vein
  C: Right suprarenal vein
  D: Renal vein
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
Solution:

Thought: 
The inferior vena cava is a large vein that carries deoxygenated blood from the lower body to the heart.
The superior mesenteric vein drains blood from the small intestine and the ascending colon.
The inferior mesenteric vein drains blood from the descending colon and the sigmoid colon.
The right suprarenal vein drains blood from the right adrenal gland.
The renal vein drains blood from the kidneys.
The inferior vena cava receives blood from the right suprarenal vein and the renal vein.
Action: Answer("C")
